ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. My child RARELY listens to stories or looks at picture books.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer; Child Impairment

ElementDescription: 2. My child RARELY does independent activities.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer; Child Impairment

ElementDescription: 3. My child RARELY plays with other children his/her age.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer; Child Impairment

ElementDescription: 4. We RARELY take him/her to visit our family or friends.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer; Family Impairment

ElementDescription: 5. We RARELY take him/her out to family restaurants.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 6. We RARELY take him/her to child friendly places (such as the playground or the library).
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 7. We RARELY take him/her grocery shopping (or on other errands).
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 8. We RARELY take him/her to meet new people or to new places.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 9. We RARELY take him/her on car, bus, subway or train trips longer than 15 minutes.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 10. I am UNABLE to see or talk to my relatives or friends as much as I would like.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 11. I am USUALLY exhausted all day.
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very true;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 12. We OFTEN get complaints about his/her behavior from his/her teacher, babysitter, school, or other adult who takes care of him/her. (N/A = no school, teacher, babysitter or other adult who takes care of him/her)
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very True;-888= N/A;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 13. My child's teacher or babysitter has talked to me about whether s/he should continue to take care of my child. (N/A =  no school, teacher or babysitter)
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very True;-888= N/A;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 14. My child has been asked to leave the place s/he was going for school, childcare or babysitting. (N/A= child never went to school, childcare or a babysitter's home)
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very True;-888= N/A;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 15. I am UNABLE to give my other child(ren) enough attention.  (N/A = only child)
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very True;-888= N/A;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 16. My spouse/partner and I have more disagreements. (N/A = no spouse/partner)
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very True;-888= N/A;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 17. I am unable to spend enough quiet or intimate time with my partner. (N/A = no spouse/partner)
Notes: 0= Not true;1= Somewhat true;2= Very True;-888= N/A;-999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 18. It has been difficult to find appropriate child care for him/her.  (N/A = stay with child by choice)
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 19. My child OFTEN needs extra attention from his/her teacher or babysitter. (N/A = rarely or never use childcare or babysitter)
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 20. My child has so much difficulty changing activities that s/he needs extra attention from the teacher or babysitter. (N/A = no regular teacher or babysitter)
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 21. We rarely leave him/her with relatives whom s/he knows well.
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 22. We rarely leave him/her with a babysitter. (N/A = rarely or never use a babysitter, but it is for other reasons)
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: 23. We rarely make changes in his/her daily schedule.
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: FLIS Child Impairment Score
FLIS Child Care Impairment Score
FLIS Child Care Impairment Score Main Version (Items 18, 21, 22, 23)
FLIS Family Impairment
FLIS Parent Impairment
FLIS Positive Growth
FLIS Total Impairment

ElementDescription: I feel that I have grown or matured
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: I have learned to speak out for myself or for my child.
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: My relationship with my spouse/partner has improved
Notes: 0= Not true ; 1= Somewhat true ; 2= Very True ; -888= N/A ; -999= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Thinking about the PAST MONTH, please rate how much your child's mood and behavior were a problem for the following CHILD activities: playing with other children his/her age
Notes: 0= Never or almost never a problem; 1= Occasionally a problem; 2= Regularly a problem; 3= Almost always a problem; 4= Always a problem; 5= So much of a problem that we never (or almost never) do this

ElementDescription: Thinking about the PAST MONTH, please rate how much your child's mood and behavior were a problem for the following CHILD activities: going to child friendly places (such as the playground or the library)
Notes: 0= Never or almost never a problem; 1= Occasionally a problem; 2= Regularly a problem; 3= Almost always a problem; 4= Always a problem; 5= So much of a problem that we never (or almost never) do this

ElementDescription: Thinking about the PAST MONTH, please rate how much your child's mood and behavior were a problem for the following CHILD activities: eating his/her meals with the rest of the family
Notes: 0= Never or almost never a problem; 1= Occasionally a problem; 2= Regularly a problem; 3= Almost always a problem; 4= Always a problem; 5= So much of a problem that we never (or almost never) do this

ElementDescription: Thinking about the PAST MONTH, please rate how much your child's mood and behavior were a problem for YOU doing the following activities: talking to my relatives or friends
Notes: 0= Never or almost never a problem; 1= Occasionally a problem; 2= Regularly a problem; 3= Almost always a problem; 4= Always a problem; 5= So much of a problem that we never (or almost never) do this

ElementDescription: Thinking about the PAST MONTH, please rate how much your child's mood and behavior were a problem for YOU doing the following activities: spending quiet or intimate time with my partner
Notes: 0= Never or almost never a problem; 1= Occasionally a problem; 2= Regularly a problem; 3= Almost always a problem; 4= Always a problem; 5= So much of a problem that we never (or almost never) do this

ElementDescription: Thinking about the PAST MONTH, please rate how much your child's mood and behavior were a problem for YOU doing the following activities: giving my other children enough attention
Notes: 0= Never or almost never a problem; 1= Occasionally a problem; 2= Regularly a problem; 3= Almost always a problem; 4= Always a problem; 5= So much of a problem that we never (or almost never) do this

ElementDescription: Thinking about the PAST MONTH, please rate how much your child's mood and behavior were a problem for YOU doing the following activities: getting along with my partner
Notes: 0= Never or almost never a problem; 1= Occasionally a problem; 2= Regularly a problem; 3= Almost always a problem; 4= Always a problem; 5= So much of a problem that we never (or almost never) do this

ElementDescription: Because of my child's mood and behavior: It has been difficult to find appropriate child care for him/her.
Notes: 0= Never or almost never; 1= Occasionally; 2= Often; 3= Almost every time I try to find childcare; 4= Every time I try to find childcare

ElementDescription: Does someone else other than yourself or your partner/spouse/the child's father take care of your child on a regular basis (at least 8 hours/week)?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: We have gotten complaints about his/her behavior from his/her teacher, babysitter, or preschool.
Notes: 0= Never or almost never; 1= Occasionally; 2= Often; 3= Almost every time I try to find childcare; 4= Every time I try to find childcare
